descriptor.name: Kotak Suraksha Scholarship Program for College Students 2024-25
descriptor.long_desc: The Kotak Suraksha Scholarship Program by Kotak Securities offers financial aid to Persons with Disabilities (PwD) category students in India. It supports Grade 9 to 12 students and those pursuing general or professional undergraduation studies within the country.

price.value: Up to ₹1,00,000 per year

list.value:
Pan-India applicants

Open to PwD (Persons with Disabilities) category students

Applicants must have secured least 55% marks in the previous qualifying examination
Children of the employees of Kotak Securities, its affiliates and Buddy4Study are not eligible.

descriptor.name: Buddy4Study-PNB Domestic Education Loan Programme
descriptor.long_desc: The Buddy4Study-PNB Education Loan programme offers financial aid for various higher education options in India and abroad. This includes courses on diplomas, undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, and job-oriented programmes in reputed institutions. Education Loan programme also supports specific postgraduate programmes and diplomas that enables students for overseas employment.

price.value: Loan amount at an interest rate starting from 8.20% to 11.25% (T&C apply)

list.value:
Indian nationals

Secured admission in diploma, undergraduate, postgraduate and PG diploma courses at a recognised Indian institution through an entrance test/merit-based selection process after completing HSC (Class 12 or equivalent)
Lower interest rates for female candidates* (T&C apply)

descriptor.name: State Merit Scholarship, Manipur
descriptor.long_desc: The State Merit Scholarship offered by the Directorate of University & Higher Education, Manipur aims to provide financial aid to economically disadvantaged students of the State in their first year of undergraduation, postgraduation, or equivalent programmes within India.

descriptor.name: Directorate of University & Higher Education, Manipur

price.value: Up to ₹7,500 per annum

list.value:
Students domiciled in the State of  Manipur 

Applicants must have secured a minimum of 60% marks in the previous qualifying examination.
 
Have passed Class 12 (or equivalent) from a recognised board such as CBSE or ICSE or hold a degree/equivalent from a recognised institute.
Students admitted to a recognised university/college for undergraduate courses (B.A., B.Sc., B.Com etc., including integrated programmes) or postgraduate courses (M.A., M.Sc., M.Com etc.) including other relevant field.

Students from higher income backgrounds whose  parental income exceeds ₹4,50,000 annually or those already receiving scholarship benefits for their studies are not included. Additionally, the programme excludes students enrolled in open universities, private/deemed universities, or management quota programs, as these avenues often have alternative financial aid options.

descriptor.name: HDFC Bank Parivartan's ECSS Programme for School Students (Merit-cum-Need Based) 2023-24
descriptor.long_desc: The HDFC Bank Parivartan's ECSS Programme offers financial aid up to ₹75,000 to underprivileged students in India facing financial difficulties. It covers school students pursuing their studies in Class 1 to 12 and those pursuing vocational training or higher education (Diploma, ITI, Polytechnic, Undergraduate and Postgraduate Studies).

price.value:
For Class 1 to 6 - ₹15,000 

For Class 7 to 12, Diploma, ITI, & Polytechnic students - ₹18,000

list.value: Class 1 to 12, diploma, ITI, and polytechnic

Indian nationals

Students in Classes 1 to 12, diploma, ITI, and polytechnic courses in private, government, or government-aided schools

Applicants must have secured at least 55% marks in the previous qualifying examination.
Priority will be given to applicants who have experienced a personal or family crisis in past three years, causing financial hardship that has threatened their ability to pursue education further.

descriptor.name: NSP Scholarships for Top Class Education for Students with Disabilities
descriptor.long_desc: NSP Scholarship for Top Class Education for Students with Disabilities offers financial aid to students with disabilities pursuing graduate, postgraduate, or diploma programmes. It is managed by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD). This scholarship provides comprehensive financial support for tuition fees, assistive devices, and living expenses to promote quality education among these students.

descriptor.name: Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD), Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India

price.value: A maintenance allowance up to ₹3,000 and other benefits

list.value:
Indian nationals

Disability of 40% or more, as defined in ‘Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016
Applicants must be pursuing a graduation/postgraduation/diploma course in a recognised institution/university, notified by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD)

descriptor.name: Kotak Suraksha Scholarship Program for School Students 2024-25
descriptor.long_desc: The Kotak Suraksha Scholarship Program by Kotak Securities offers financial aid to Persons with Disabilities (PwD) category students in India. It supports Grade 9 to 12 students and those pursuing general or professional undergraduation studies within the country.

price.value: Scholarship up to ₹50,000 per year

list.value:
Pan-India applicants

Open to PwD (Persons with Disabilities) category students

Applicants must have secured least 55% marks in the previous qualifying examination
Children of the employees of Kotak Securities, its affiliates and Buddy4Study are not eligible.

descriptor.name: Buddy4Study-PNB International Education Loan Programme
descriptor.long_desc: The Buddy4Study-PNB Education Loan programme offers financial aid for various higher education options in India and abroad. This includes courses on diplomas, undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, and job-oriented programmes in reputed institutions. Education Loan programme also supports specific postgraduate programmes and diplomas that enables students for overseas employment.

price.value: Loan amount at an interest rate ranging from 9.25% to 11.25%* (T&C apply)

list.value:
Indian nationals

Secured admission in one of the specified courses  through an entrance test/merit-based selection process after completing HSC (Class 12 or equivalent)
Lower interest rates for female candidates* (T&C apply)

descriptor.name: HDFC Bank Parivartan's ECSS Programme for Postgraduate Courses (Merit-cum-Need Based) 2023-24
descriptor.long_desc: The HDFC Bank Parivartan's ECSS Programme offers financial aid up to ₹75,000 to underprivileged students in India facing financial difficulties. It covers school students pursuing their studies in Class 1 to 12 and those pursuing vocational training or higher education (Diploma, ITI, Polytechnic, Undergraduate and Postgraduate Studies).

price.value:
For general postgraduate courses - ₹35,000      

For professional postgraduate courses - ₹75,000

list.value: General PG courses such as MCom, MA, etc. and professional PG courses such as MTech, MBA, etc.

Indian nationals

Students pursuing postgraduation courses (general courses - MCom, MA, etc. and professional courses - MTech, MBA, etc.) in recognized colleges or universities in India


Secured at least 55% marks in the previous qualifying examination
Priority will be given to applicants who have experienced a personal or family crisis in past three years, causing financial hardship that has threatened their ability to pursue education further.

descriptor.name: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship scheme
descriptor.long_desc: This is a centrally-funded scheme that offers financial aid to deserving students from underprivileged backgrounds in order to help them transition smoothly and pursue their secondary education further (Class 9 onwards).

descriptor.name: Department of School Education and Literacy, Government of India

price.value: ₹12,000 per annum

list.value:
Indian citizens

Enrolled in Class 9 in a government, government-aided or local body schools
Relaxation of 5% will be given to SC/ST students.

descriptor.name: Pre-Matric Scholarship for ST Students, Manipur
descriptor.long_desc: The Pre-Matric Scholarship for ST Students, Manipur is a central government initiative to provide aid to Scheduled Tribe (ST) students pursuing their studies in Class 9 and 10. It aims to support these students financially and reduce dropout rates during the crucial transition period from elementary to secondary school.

descriptor.name: Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India

price.value: Up to ₹350 per month for 10 months and other benefits

list.value:
Scheduled Tribes (ST) category students domiciled in the State of Manipur 


Applicants should be pursuing their studies in Class 9 or 10 in a government school or a school recognised by the Government or a Central/State Board of Secondary Education
Applicants must not be availing benefits under any other centrally-funded pre-matric scholarship programme

descriptor.name: JN Tata Endowment Loan Scholarship 2024-25
descriptor.long_desc: The JN Tata Endowment awards merit-based loan scholarships to Indian students for pursuing higher studies abroad. Each year, 90 to 100 scholars are selected across various disciplines, including the Natural Sciences (Applied, Pure, and Social), management, law, commerce, and the fine arts.

price.value: Loan scholarship up to ₹10 lakh

list.value:
Indian citizens

Not older than 45 years old

Applicants must have secured a minimum 60% marks in undergraduate or postgraduate studies from a recognised Indian university leading to a full-time postgraduate programme abroad

This scholarship is only meant for full-time postgraduate studies abroad, excluding short-term programmes, online/distance learning programmes and studies in India (Undergraduation or Postgraduation Studies).

descriptor.name: HDFC Bank Parivartan's ECSS Programme for Undergraduate Courses (Merit-cum-Need Based) 2023-24
descriptor.long_desc: The HDFC Bank Parivartan's ECSS Programme offers financial aid up to ₹75,000 to underprivileged students in India facing financial difficulties. It covers school students pursuing their studies in Class 1 to 12 and those pursuing vocational training or higher education (Diploma, ITI, Polytechnic, Undergraduate and Postgraduate Studies).

price.value:
For general undergraduate courses - ₹30,000 

For professional undergraduate courses - ₹50,000

list.value: General graduation courses such as BCom, BSc, BA, BCA, etc. and professional graduation courses such as BTech, MBBS, LLB, B Arch, Nursing

Indian nationals

Students pursuing graduation courses (general courses- BCom, BSc, BA, BCA, etc. and professional courses- BTech, MBBS, LLB, B Arch, Nursing) in recognized colleges or universities in India

Secured at least 55% marks in the previous qualifying examination
Priority will be given to applicants who have experienced a personal or family crisis in past three years, causing financial hardship that has threatened their ability to pursue education further.
